text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/32ymDqH0cNs/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/32ymDqH0cNs&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/32ymDqH0cNs&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhagwat Gita part 11</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/VjlDP2JLRkM/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/VjlDP2JLRkM&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/VjlDP2JLRkM&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhagawat Gita part 12</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://0.gvt0.com/vi/PNpNuAMIw6w/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/PNpNuAMIw6w&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/PNpNuAMIw6w&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nGita consists of the teaching given to the pupil Arjuna by <span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">Lord Shri Krishna</span> on the battlefield of Kurukshetra when the pupil, at the critical moment when the war was about to commence, was in doubt as to whether he was to follow the promptings of his personal affection and reverence for those on the opposite side or follow the dictates of duty. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nIn unequivocal terms the Lord asks Arjuna to fight the battle irrespective of his personal ties with persons on the other side. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">The occasion is utilized by the Lord to explain the whole purpose of Life, the meaning of all the world process and the place of man in the scheme of things. As the colophon at the end of every chapter puts it, the Gita is an Upanishad, it is a philosophical treatise. But it is something more than that. It is a code of conduct for man applicable to varying temperaments, various avocations and various levels of development. It is this aspect that makes for the unique place which the Gita has among the scriptures of the world. </span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span>The most important contribution of the Gita to the religious thought of India is the emphasis the Lord lays on action (karma) in Sanskrit. The attitude of escapism is severely condemned by the Lord. He says, \"Nor can anyone, even for an instant, remain really action-less.\" What binds a man is not action but his attachment to the fruit of the action. And so the lord repeatedly enjoins activity without attachment to the fruit.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe Lord stresses throughout the central idea of all Indian philosophies, the Imminence of God and the interdependence of man - not only man, but of all beings. \"The Lord dwelleth in the heart of all beings.\" 'Having pervaded this whole universe with one fragment of Myself, I remain.\" Everything in the universe partakes of one life; the wise man realizes that the outer differences are deceptive and illusionary, he looks beyond the veil and sees the common basis of all beings. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span>In the <span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">Bhagavad Gita</span>, <span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">Lord Krishna</span> describes the rhythmic play of creation in the following words:<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"At the end of the night of time all things return to my nature, and when the new day of time begins I bring them again into light.Thus through my nature I bring forth all creation and this rolls around in the circles of time.\"<br />\n<br />\n\"But I am not bound by this vast work of creation. I am and I watch the drama of works.<br />\nI watch and in its work of creation nature brings forth all that moves and moves not; and thus the revolutions of the world go round.\"<br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break;\" />&nbsp;<br style=\"mso-special-character: line-break;\" />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;   </span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><strong><span style=\"font-weight: normal; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.hinduwisdom.info/quotes1_20.htm#Q13\"><span style=\"color: windowtext;\">Aldous Huxley</span></a> </span></strong>(1894-1963) the English novelist and essayist wrote: \"<span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">The Bhagavad-Gita is the most systematic statement of spiritual evolution of endowing value to mankind. The Gita is one of the clearest and most comprehensive summaries of the spiritual thoughts ever to have been made.\"</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; mso-border-bottom-alt: solid #EEEEEE .75pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-padding-alt: 0in 0in 3.0pt 0in; padding: 0in; tab-stops: list .5in; text-indent: -0.25in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #090909; font-family: &quot;symbol&quot;; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"mso-list: Ignore;\">\u00b7<span style=\"font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font: 7pt/normal &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span style=\"color: #090909; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warriors may not engage in any \u201cunfair\u201d warfare.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-FXz1tgm0pNs/TsJeffx7ecI/AAAAAAAAIbI/4o-gPL-oDx4/s1600/A.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"280\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-FXz1tgm0pNs/TsJeffx7ecI/AAAAAAAAIbI/4o-gPL-oDx4/s400/A.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">THE WAR STARTS--</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4SBas2PdfyY/TsJgtKd8MxI/AAAAAAAAIbY/1_VIJOCQtPM/s1600/imagesCAIPO1M2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4SBas2PdfyY/TsJgtKd8MxI/AAAAAAAAIbY/1_VIJOCQtPM/s400/imagesCAIPO1M2.jpg\" width=\"313\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\">ALL was ready for the battle. The warriors on both sides gathered together and solemnly bound themselves to honor the traditional rules of war. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The code of conduct in war and methods of warfare vary from time to time. It is only if what was in vogue at the time of the Mahabharata war is kept in mind that we can understand the epic. Otherwise, the story would be puzzling in places.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">From what follows, the reader may have some idea of the rules of warfare followed in the Kurukshetra battle. Each day, the battle was over at sunset, and the hostiles mixed freely like friends. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Single combats might only be between equals and one could not use methods not in accordance with dharma. Thus those who left the field or retired would not be attacked. A horseman could attack only a horseman, not one on foot. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Likewise, charioteers, elephant troops and infantrymen could engage themselves in battle only with their opposite numbers in the enemy ranks. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Those who sought quarter or surrendered were safe from slaughter. Nor might one, for the moment disengaged, direct his weapons against another who was engaged in combat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">It was wrong to slay one who had been disarmed or whose attention was directed elsewhere or who was retreating or who had lost his armor. And no shafts were to be directed against non-combatant attendants or those engaged in blowing conchs or beating drums. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">These were the rules that the Kauravas and the Pandavas solemnly declared they would follow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The passage of time has witnessed many changes in men's ideas of right and wrong. Nothing is exempt from attack in modern warfare. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Not only are munitions made the target of attack, but dumb animals such as horses, camels, mules and medical stores, nay, non-combatants of all ages, are destroyed without compunction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Sometimes the established conventions went overboard even in the Mahabharata war. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">We see clearly in the story that occasional transgressions took place for one reason or another. But, on the whole, the accepted rules of honorable and humane war were observed by both sides in the Kurukshetra battle. And the occasional violations were looked upon as wrong and shameful.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Addressing the princes under his command, Bhishma said: \"Heroes, yours is a glorious opportunity. Before you, are the gates of heaven wide open. The joy of living with Indra and Brahma awaits you. Pursue the path of your ancestors and follow the kshatriya dharma. Fight with joy and attain fame and greatness. A kshatriya does not wish to die of disease or old age in his bed but prefers to die on the battlefield,\" and the princes responded by ordering their trumpets to be sounded and shouted victory to the Kauravas. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-skiuY5eGXl0/TsJg_Tw3R8I/AAAAAAAAIbo/1aBeD2OibgE/s1600/D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-skiuY5eGXl0/TsJg_Tw3R8I/AAAAAAAAIbo/1aBeD2OibgE/s400/D.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">On Bhishma's flag shone brightly the palm tree and five stars. On Aswatthama's the lion tail fluttered in the air. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">In Drona's golden-hued standard, the ascetic's bowl and the bow glistened, and the cobra of Duryodhana's famed banner danced proudly with outspread hood. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">On Kripa's flag was depicted a bull, while Jayadratha's carried a wild boar. Likewise others and the battlefield thus presented a pageant of flags. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Seeing the Kaurava forces ranged in battle array, Yudhishthira gave orders to Arjuna:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9Oxg0wW65mQ/TsJhD3GY6rI/AAAAAAAAIbw/GL7xJ9QXNUo/s1600/imagesCA0DT5P6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"193\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9Oxg0wW65mQ/TsJhD3GY6rI/AAAAAAAAIbw/GL7xJ9QXNUo/s400/imagesCA0DT5P6.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"The enemy force is very large. Our army being smaller, our tactics should be concentration rather than deployment that will only weaken us. Array our forces, therefore, in needle formation.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Now, when Arjuna saw men arrayed on both sides for mutual slaughter, he was deeply agitated and Krishna spoke to him in order to quell his agitation and remove his doubts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Krishna's exhortation to Arjuna at this juncture is the Bhagavad Gita, which is enshrined in millions of hearts as the Word of God. The Bhagavad Gita is acknowledged by all as one of the supreme treasures of human literature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Its gospel of devotion to duty, without attachment or desire of reward, has shown the way of life for all men, rich or poor, learned or ignorant, who have sought for light in the dark problems of life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVERYTHING was ready for the battle to begin. At this tense moment, both armies saw with amazement Yudhishthira, the steadfast and brave son of Pandu, suddenly doff his armor and put away his weapons. Descending from his chariot, he proceeded on foot towards the commander of the Kaurava forces. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q6Rc0BlwDKM/TsJhIkXMYJI/AAAAAAAAIb4/Ufy1tjlg6nc/s1600/imagesCA0OY62Q.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Q6Rc0BlwDKM/TsJhIkXMYJI/AAAAAAAAIb4/Ufy1tjlg6nc/s400/imagesCA0OY62Q.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"What is this that Yudhishthira is doing?\" asked everyone and was puzzled by this sudden and silent proceeding on the part of the Pandava.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dhananjaya too was perplexed and he jumped down from his chariot and ran to Yudhishthira. The other brothers and Krishna also joined. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">They feared that perhaps Yudhishthira, surrendering to his natural inclination, had suddenly decided to seek peace on any terms and was going forward to announce this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"King, why are you proceeding to the enemy's lines in this strange manner? You have told us nothing. The enemy is ready for battle, their soldiers sheathed in armor and with uplifted weapons. But you have doffed your armor and thrown aside your weapons and are proceeding forward, unattended and on foot. Tell us what you are about.\" Thus said Arjuna to Dharmaputra. But Yudhishthira was immersed in deep thought and proceeded forward silently. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yC-cbM3KFC4/TsJhM2BWXqI/AAAAAAAAIcA/yyKCl_1LSLQ/s1600/imagesCA0XJORD.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yC-cbM3KFC4/TsJhM2BWXqI/AAAAAAAAIcA/yyKCl_1LSLQ/s400/imagesCA0XJORD.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then Vasudeva, who knew the hearts of men, smiled and said: \"He is going to the elders to ask for their benediction before commencing this terrible fight. He feels it is not right to start such a grave proceeding without formally taking such benediction and permission. He goes to the grandsire to take his blessing and that of Dronacharya. So he goes unarmed. It is right that he does this. He knows proprieties. It is only thus that we might fare well in this battle.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The men in Duryodhana's army, when they saw Yudhishthira advancing with hands clasped in humble attitude, thought: \"Here is the Pandava coming to sue for peace, frightened at our strength. Truly this man brings disgrace to the race of kshatriyas. Why was this coward born among us?\" Thus did they talk among themselves reviling Dharmaputra though delighted at the prospect of securing victory without a blow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yudhishthira went through the lines of soldiers armed from head to foot and proceeded straight to where Bhishma was and, bending low and touching his feet in salutation, said: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-49j7X_ezeLI/TsJhR9fc_FI/AAAAAAAAIcI/EJrLjt_XQf0/s1600/imagesCA2SODMV.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"258\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-49j7X_ezeLI/TsJhR9fc_FI/AAAAAAAAIcI/EJrLjt_XQf0/s400/imagesCA2SODMV.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Grandsire, permit us to begin the battle. We have dared to give battle to you, our unconquerable and incomparable grandsire. We seek benediction before beginning the fight.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Child,\" replied the grandsire, \"born in the race of Bharatas, you have acted worthily and according to our code of conduct. It gives me joy to see this. Fight and you will have victory. I am not a free agent. I am bound by my obligation to the king and must fight on the side of the Kauravas. But you will not be defeated.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After thus obtaining the permission and the blessings of the grandsire, Yudhishthira went to Drona and circumambulated and bowed, according to form, to the acharya, who also gave his blessings, saying:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"I am under inescapable obligations to the Kauravas, O son of Dharma. Our vested interests enslave us and become our masters. Thus have I become bound to the Kauravas. I shall fight on their side. But yours will be the victory.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yudhishthira similarly approached and obtained the blessings of Kripacharya and uncle Salya and returned to the Pandava lines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nXhQiStB4vo/TsJhV0tNirI/AAAAAAAAIcQ/8qeP-E47jLY/s1600/imagesCA8D20RL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"254\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nXhQiStB4vo/TsJhV0tNirI/AAAAAAAAIcQ/8qeP-E47jLY/s400/imagesCA8D20RL.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The battle began, commencing with single combats between the leading chiefs armed with equal weapons. Bhishma and Partha, Satyaki and Kritavarma, Abhimanyu and Brihatbala, Duryodhana and Bhima, Yudhishthira and Salya, and Dbrishtadyumna and Drona were thus engaged in great battles. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly, thousands of other warriors fought severally according to the rules of war of those days. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Besides these numerous single combats between renowned warriors, there was also indiscriminate fighting among common soldiers. The name of \"sankula yuddha\" was given to such free fighting and promiscuous carnage. The Kurukshetra battle witnessed many such \"sankula\" fights wherein countless men fought and died in the mad lust of battle. On the field lay piles of slaughtered soldiers, charioteers, elephants and horses. The ground became a bloody mire in which it was difficult for the chariots to move about. In modern battles there is no such thing as single combats. It is all \"sankula.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kauravas fought under Bhishma's command for ten days. After him, Drona took the command. When Drona died, Karna succeeded to the command. Karna fell towards the close of the seventeenth day's battle. And Salya led the Kaurava army on the eighteenth and last day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8CJfgp1pAsc/TsJhaEStsFI/AAAAAAAAIcY/YIfTsdbiUl0/s1600/imagesCA8UFBID.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8CJfgp1pAsc/TsJhaEStsFI/AAAAAAAAIcY/YIfTsdbiUl0/s400/imagesCA8UFBID.jpg\" width=\"284\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Towards the latter part of the battle, many savage and unchivalrous deeds were done. Chivalry and rules of war die hard, for there is an innate nobility in human nature. But difficult situations and temptations arise which men are too weak to resist, especially when they are exhausted with fighting and warped with hatred and bloodshed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even great men commit wrong and their lapses thereafter furnish bad examples to others, and dharma comes to be disregarded more and more easily and frequently. Thus does violence beget and nourish adharma and plunge the world in wickedness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"mso-cellspacing: 1.5pt; mso-yfti-tbllook: 1184; width: 100%;\"><tbody>\n<tr style=\"mso-yfti-firstrow: yes; mso-yfti-irow: 0;\">   <td style=\"background-color: transparent; border: rgb(0, 0, 0); padding: 0.75pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">DUHSASANA was leading the Kaurava forces and Bhimasena did the   same on the Pandava side. The noise of battle rolled and rent the air. The   kettledrums, trumpets, horns and conchs made the sky ring with their clamor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Horses neighed, charging elephants trumpeted and the warriors   uttered their lion-roars. Arrows flew in the air like burning meteors.   Fathers and sons, uncles and nephews slew one another forgetful of old   affection and ties of blood. It was a mad and terrible carnage. In the   forenoon of the first day's battle the Pandava army was badly shaken.   Wherever Bhishma's chariot went, it was like the dance of the destroyer.   Abhimanyu could not bear this and he attacked the grandsire. When the oldest   and the youngest warriors thus met in battle, the gods came to watch the   combat. Abhimanyu's flag, displaying the golden karnikara tree brightly waved   on his chariot. </span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-GdvBIpSXiSs/TsJhe8JeZuI/AAAAAAAAIcg/UwE3lzb1c8M/s1600/imagesCA12Z99J.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-GdvBIpSXiSs/TsJhe8JeZuI/AAAAAAAAIcg/UwE3lzb1c8M/s400/imagesCA12Z99J.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kritavarma was hit by one of his arrows and Salya was hit five   times. Bhishma himself was hit nine times by Abhimanyu's shafts. Durmukha's   charioteer was struck by one of Abhimanyu's sword-edge arrow and his severed   head rolled on the ground. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another broke Kripa's bow. Abhimanyu's feats brought down   showers of flowers from the gods who looked on. Bhishma and the warrior   supporting him exclaimed: \"Indeed, a worthy son to Dhananjaya!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then the Kaurava warriors made a combined attack on the valiant   youth. But he stood against them all. He parried with his own all the shafts   discharged by Bhishma. </span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-i3n07cQipmw/TsJhjA84miI/AAAAAAAAIco/p-TKF1q9QuA/s1600/imagesCA76Y5IP.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-i3n07cQipmw/TsJhjA84miI/AAAAAAAAIco/p-TKF1q9QuA/s400/imagesCA76Y5IP.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of his well-aimed arrows brought the grandsire's palm tree   flag down. Seeing this, Bhimasena was overjoyed and made a great lion-roar   that further inspired the valiant nephew. Great was the grandsire's joy,   seeing the valor of the young hero. Unwillingly, he had to use his full   strength against the boy. Virata, his son Uttara, Dhrishtadyumna, the son of   Drupada and Bhima came to relieve the young hero and attacked the grandsire   who then turned his attentions on them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uttara, the son of Virata, rode an elephant and led a fierce   charge on Salya. Salya's chariot horses were trampled to death and thereupon   he hurled a javelin at Uttara. It went with unerring aim and pierced him in   the chest. </span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Rq8Yd3rNMho/TsJhnJUAzcI/AAAAAAAAIcw/gV8WDu_y9BA/s1600/imagesCA80FZ75.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Rq8Yd3rNMho/TsJhnJUAzcI/AAAAAAAAIcw/gV8WDu_y9BA/s640/imagesCA80FZ75.jpg\" width=\"404\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goad he had in his hand dropped and he rolled down dead. But   the elephant did not withdraw. It continued charging until Salya cut off its   trunk and hit it in many places with his arrows. And then it uttered a loud   cry and fell dead. Salya got into Kritavarma's car.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virata's son Sveta saw Salya slay his younger brother. His anger   rose, like fire fed by libations of butter. And he drove his chariot towards   Salya. Seven chariot warriors at once came up in support of Salya and   protected him from all sides. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arrows were showered on Sveta and the missiles sped across like   lightning in clouds. Sveta defended himself marvelously. He parried their   shafts with his own and cut their javelins down as they sped towards him. The   warriors in both armies were amazed at the skill displayed by Sveta.   Duryodhana lost no time now and sent forces to relieve Salya. Whereupon there   was a great battle. Thousands of soldiers perished, and numerous were the   chariots broken and the horses and elephants killed. Sveta succeeded in   putting Duryodhana's men to flight and he pushed forward and attacked   Bhishma.</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-80n40nOEBUs/TsJhsKnuQxI/AAAAAAAAIc4/Sd2ANJLtU2Q/s1600/imagesCA90HNHL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-80n40nOEBUs/TsJhsKnuQxI/AAAAAAAAIc4/Sd2ANJLtU2Q/s400/imagesCA90HNHL.jpg\" width=\"286\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhishma's flag was brought down by Sveta. Bhishma, in his turn,   killed Sveta's horses and charioteer. There upon, they hurled javelins at one   another and fought on. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sveta took a mace, and swinging it, sent it at Bhishma's car   which was smashed to pieces. But the grandsire, even before the mace dashed   against the chariot, had anticipated it and jumped down. From the ground he   pulled the string of his bow to his ear and sent a fatal arrow at Sveta.   Sveta was struck and fell dead. Duhsasana blew his horn and danced in joy.   This was followed by a great attack on the Pandava army by Bhishma.</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1vS-Xsijyu0/TsJhxIzVenI/AAAAAAAAIdA/8R3tclcplAs/s1600/imagesCA324GN7.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1vS-Xsijyu0/TsJhxIzVenI/AAAAAAAAIdA/8R3tclcplAs/s400/imagesCA324GN7.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Pandava forces suffered greatly on the first day of the   battle. Dharmaputra was seized with apprehension, and Duryodhana's joy was   unbounded. The brothers came to Krishna and were engaged in anxious   consultations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-margin-top-alt: auto;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Chief among Bharatas,\" said Krishna to Yudhishthira,   \"do not fear. God has blessed you with valiant brothers. Why should you   entertain any doubts? There is Satyaki and there are Virata, Drupada and   Dhrishtadyumna, besides myself. What reason is there for you to be dejected?   Do you forget that Sikhandin is awaiting for his predestined victim   Bhishma?\" Thus did Krishna comfort Yudhishthira. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>  </tr>\n<tr style=\"mso-yfti-irow: 1; mso-yfti-lastrow: yes;\">   <td style=\"background-color: transparent; border: rgb(0, 0, 0); padding: 0.75pt;\"><div align=\"center\">\n<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"mso-cellspacing: 0in; mso-padding-alt: 0in 0in 0in 0in; mso-yfti-tbllook: 1184; width: 100%;\"><tbody>\n<tr style=\"mso-yfti-firstrow: yes; mso-yfti-irow: 0; mso-yfti-lastrow: yes;\">     <td style=\"background-color: transparent; border: rgb(0, 0, 0); padding: 0in; width: 100%;\" width=\"100%\"></td>    </tr>\n</tbody></table>\n</div>\n</td>  </tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gE8YZqwCBDg/TsJh1vHXrGI/AAAAAAAAIdI/7u_O4rMmzdE/s1600/imagesCACKEW50.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"268\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gE8YZqwCBDg/TsJh1vHXrGI/AAAAAAAAIdI/7u_O4rMmzdE/s400/imagesCACKEW50.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">65. The Second Day</span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">THE Pandava army, having fared badly on the first day of the battle, Dhrishtadyumna, the Generalissimo, devised measures to avoid a repetition of it. On the second day, the army was most carefully arrayed and everything was done to instil confidence. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Duryodhana, filled with conceit on account of the success on the first day, stood in the center of his army and addressed his warriors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Heroes in armor\", he said in a loud voice, \"our victory is assured. Fight and care not for life.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Kaurava army, led by Bhishma, again made strong attack on the Pandava forces and broke their formation, killing large numbers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fkSkemU3ptw/TsJiJp_nYHI/AAAAAAAAIdQ/d97ww6WsnrY/s1600/imagesCACQL8SA.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"307\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-fkSkemU3ptw/TsJiJp_nYHI/AAAAAAAAIdQ/d97ww6WsnrY/s400/imagesCACQL8SA.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna, turning to Krishna, his charioteer, said: \"If we continue in this way, our army will soon be totally destroyed by the grandsire. Unless we slay Bhishma, I am afraid we can not save our army.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Dhananjaya, then get ready. There is the grandsire's chariot,\" replied Krishna, and drove straight towards him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The chariot sped forward at a great pace.<b> </b>The grandsire sent his shafts welcoming the challenge. Duryodhana had ordered his men to protect the grandsire most vigilantly and never to let him expose himself to danger. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Accordingly, all the warriors, supporting the grandsire, at once intervened and attacked Arjuna who, however, fought on unconcerned. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">It was well known that there were but three on the Kaurava side who could stand against Arjuna with any chance of success the grandsire Bhishma, Drona and Karna. Arjuna made short work of the warriors, who intervened in support of<b> </b>Bhishma. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-M7wT5rw8lwE/TsJiOlPL3AI/AAAAAAAAIdY/EL9EFOjsZRI/s1600/imagesCADZ74HZ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-M7wT5rw8lwE/TsJiOlPL3AI/AAAAAAAAIdY/EL9EFOjsZRI/s400/imagesCADZ74HZ.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The way in which he wielded his great bow on this occasion, extorted the admiration of all the great generals in the army. His chariot flashed hither and thither sundering hostile ranks like forked lightning, so rapidly that the eye ached to follow its career.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Duryodhana's heart beat fast as he watched this combat. His confidence in the great Bhishma began to be shaken.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Son of Ganga,\" Duryodhana said, \"it seems as if even while you and Drona are alive and fighting, this irresistible combination of Arjuna and Krishna will destroy our entire army. Karna whose devotion and loyalty to me are most genuine stands aside and does not fight for me only because of you. I fear I shall be deceived and you will not take steps quickly to destroy Phalguna (Arjuna).\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h9Xx2XRG_mQ/TsJiTVZQevI/AAAAAAAAIdg/z0QAdz7EbD4/s1600/imagesCAEEII4B.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h9Xx2XRG_mQ/TsJiTVZQevI/AAAAAAAAIdg/z0QAdz7EbD4/s400/imagesCAEEII4B.jpg\" width=\"314\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The gods came down to watch the combat between Bhishma and Arjuna. These were two of the greatest warriors on earth. Both chariots were drawn by white steeds. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">From either side flew arrows in countless number. Shaft met shaft in the air and sometimes the grandsire's missile hit Arjuna's breast and that of Madhava (Krishna). And the blood flowing made Madhava more beautiful than ever as he stood like a green palasa tree in full bloom with crimson flowers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna's wrath rose when he saw his dear charioteer hit and he pulled his bow and sent well-aimed arrows at the grandsire. The combatants were equal and the battle raged for a long while. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">In the movements the chariots made they were so close to one another and moved about so fast that it was not possible to say where Arjuna was and where Bhishma. Only the flag could be distinguished. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YhLBQfOe47I/TsJiXwWATGI/AAAAAAAAIdo/hxheIPSaUyo/s1600/imagesCAF0PZD2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"186\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YhLBQfOe47I/TsJiXwWATGI/AAAAAAAAIdo/hxheIPSaUyo/s400/imagesCAF0PZD2.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">As this great and wonderful scene was enacted in one part of the field, at another place a fierce battle was being fought between Drona and his born enemy Dhrishtadyumna, the son of the king of the Panchalas and brother of Draupadi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Drona's attack was powerful and Dhrishtadyumna was wounded badly. But the latter retaliated with equal vigor and with a grin of hatred he shot arrows and sped other missiles at Drona. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Drona<b> </b>defended himself with great skill. He parried the sharp missiles and the heavy maces hurled at him with his arrows and broke them to pieces even as they sped in the air. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5FcdyqBv0R8/TsJicpSnftI/AAAAAAAAIdw/7Lve-oTTgxg/s1600/imagesCAFTISOX.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5FcdyqBv0R8/TsJicpSnftI/AAAAAAAAIdw/7Lve-oTTgxg/s400/imagesCAFTISOX.jpg\" width=\"345\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Many times did Dhrishtadyumna's bow break, hit by Drona's arrows. One of Drona's arrows killed the Panchala prince's charioteer. Thereupon Dhrishtadyumna took up a mace and, jumping down from the chariot, went forward on foot. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Drona sent an arrow that brought the mace down. Dhrishtadyumna then drew his sword and rushed forward like a lion springing on its elephant prey. But Drona again disabled him and prevented his advance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Just then Bhima, who saw the Panchala's predicament, sent a shower of arrows on Drona and carried Dhrishtadyumna to safety in his chariot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Duryodhana who saw this sent the Kalinga forces against Bhimasena. Bhima killed the Kalinga warriors in great number. Like Death itself he moved about among his enemies and felled them to the ground. So fierce was the destruction that the entire army trembled in fear. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9NZsgT-ZYew/TsJihXfd8qI/AAAAAAAAId4/BJeD-6JIBLA/s1600/imagesCAG2SR24.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"229\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9NZsgT-ZYew/TsJihXfd8qI/AAAAAAAAId4/BJeD-6JIBLA/s320/imagesCAG2SR24.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">When Bhishma saw this, he came to relieve the Kalingas. Satyaki, Abhimanyu and other warriors came up in support of Bhima. One of Satyaki's shafts brought Bhishma's charioteer down and the horses of Bhishma's chariot, left uncontrolled, bolted carrying Bhishma away from the field. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Pandava army was wild with enthusiasm when Bhishma's chariot sped thus out of the field. They took advantage of the situation and made a fierce attack on the Kaurava army. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Great was the loss the Kaurava army suffered in that day's battle as a result of Arjuna's deeds of valor. The generals of the Kaurava army were greatly perturbed and their previous day's enthusiasm had all disappeared. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">They eagerly looked forward to sunset when there would be an end to the day's battle. As the sun sank in the west, Bhishma said to Drona: \"It is well we stop the fighting now. Our army is disheartened and weary.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">On the side of the Pandavas, Dhananjaya and others returned in great cheer to their camp, with bands playing. At the end of the second day's battle, the Kauravas were in the mood that the Pandavas were in the previous evening. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3B_dvVSM-c0/TsJilp0f3MI/AAAAAAAAIeA/oKY69aTRIQc/s1600/imagesCAG5XU7D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3B_dvVSM-c0/TsJilp0f3MI/AAAAAAAAIeA/oKY69aTRIQc/s400/imagesCAG5XU7D.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">The Third Day's Battle</span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">ON the morning of the third day Bhishma arrayed his army in eagle formation and himself led it while Duryodhana and his forces protected the rear. So great was the care taken over every detail that the Kauravas were certain that there could be no mishap for them that day. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Pandavas too arrayed their forces with skill. Dhananjaya and Dhrishtadyumna decided in favor of a crescent formation of their army so as more effectually to cope with the eagle formation of the enemy's forces. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ha9geFyjKRo/TsJiqFwjKwI/AAAAAAAAIeI/56BZbh8hWsA/s1600/imagesCAG49UYP.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"268\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ha9geFyjKRo/TsJiqFwjKwI/AAAAAAAAIeI/56BZbh8hWsA/s400/imagesCAG49UYP.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoBodyTextIndent\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">On the right horn of the crescent stood Bhima and on the left Arjuna, leading the respective divisions. The battle began. All arms were at once engaged and blood flowed in torrents and the dust that was raised by chariots, horses and elephants rose to hide the sun. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Dhananjaya's attack was powerful but the enemy stood firm. A counter-attack was made by the Kauravas concentrating on Arjuna's position. Javelins and spears and other missiles flew in the air shining like forked lightning in a thunderstorm. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Like a great cloud of locusts the shafts covered Arjuna's chariot. But with amazing skill he raised a moving fortification around his chariot with arrows discharged in an unending stream from his famous bow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kSnymlft1Qk/TsJiuHD7uLI/AAAAAAAAIeQ/fXx8n80wcRk/s1600/imagesCAHF2IBQ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"240\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kSnymlft1Qk/TsJiuHD7uLI/AAAAAAAAIeQ/fXx8n80wcRk/s320/imagesCAHF2IBQ.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoBodyTextIndent\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">At another point Sakuni led a large force against Satyaki and Abhimanyu. Satyaki's chariot was broken to pieces and he had to scramble up Abhimanyu's chariot and thereafter both fought from the same chariot. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">They were able to destroy Sakuni's forces. Drona and Bhishma jointly attacked Dharmaputra's division and Nakula and Sahadeva joined their brother in opposing Drona's offensive. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhima and his son Ghatotkacha attacked Duryodhana's division and in that day's battle the son appeared to excel his great father in valor. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhima's shafts hit Duryodhana and he lay in swoon in his chariot. His charioteer quickly drove the chariot away from the scene. He feared that the Kaurava forces would be completely demoralised if they saw that the prince had been<b> </b>disabled. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">But even this movement created great confusion. Bhimasena took full advantage of the position and worked havoc among the fleeing Kaurava forces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gb29I2MWJVo/TsJiyosP9xI/AAAAAAAAIeY/bSRpYTdOJ0s/s1600/imagesCAI3JWIA.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"207\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gb29I2MWJVo/TsJiyosP9xI/AAAAAAAAIeY/bSRpYTdOJ0s/s320/imagesCAI3JWIA.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Drona and Bhishma who saw the discomfiture and confusion of the Kaurava army came up quickly and restored confidence. The scattered forces were brought together and Duryodhana was again seen leading them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"How can you stand thus,\" said Duryodhana to the grandsire, \"looking on when our forces are scattered and put to disgraceful flight? I fear you are too kind to the Pandavas. Why did you not tell me frankly 'I love the Pandavas; Dhrishtadyumna and Satyaki are my friends and I cannot attack or slay them.' You should have stated the position explicitly to me. Surely these men are not equal to you. And if you were so minded, you could deal with them easily. Even now, it would be best if you and Drona told me frankly your mind in the matter.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The chagrin of defeat, and the knowledge that the grandsire disapproved of his ways made Duryodhana speak thus bitterly. But Bhishma merely smiled and said: \"Wasn't I quite frank in my advice to you? That advice you rejected when you decided on war. I tried to prevent the war but, now that it has come, I am fulfilling my duties by you with all my might. I am an old man and what I am doing is quite my utmost.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Saying thus, the grandsire resumed his operations. The turn of events in the forenoon had been so much in their favor that the delighted Pandavas were now somewhat careless. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JVCtnjSbThw/TsJi5LGSCjI/AAAAAAAAIeg/GOwa1aBsNSY/s1600/imagesCAIAIYLI.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"212\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-JVCtnjSbThw/TsJi5LGSCjI/AAAAAAAAIeg/GOwa1aBsNSY/s320/imagesCAIAIYLI.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">They did not expect Bhishma to rally his forces and attack them again. But stung by Duryodhana's reproaches, the grandsire raged about the field like a destroying fire. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">He rallied his men and delivered the most severe attack yet made on the Pandava army. The latter thought that the grandsire had multiplied himself into a number of Bhishmas fighting at several points. So swift were his movements that afternoon. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Those who opposed him were struck down and perished like months in the fire. The Pandava army was thoroughly broken and began to scatter. Vasudeva, Partha and Sikhandin tried hard<b> </b>to restore order and confidence, but were unsuccessful. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Dhanjaya,\" said Krishna, \"now has the critical time come. Be true to your decision not to flinch from your duty to kill in battle Bhishma, Drona and all the other friends and relatives and respected elders. You have pledged yourself to it and you have now to carry it out. Otherwise our army is lost beyond redemption. You must now attack the grandsire.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TLjJfXTuMK0/TsJjAegQYQI/AAAAAAAAIeo/5O4K2vf7aIU/s1600/imagesCAJ2WDIZ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TLjJfXTuMK0/TsJjAegQYQI/AAAAAAAAIeo/5O4K2vf7aIU/s400/imagesCAJ2WDIZ.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Drive on,\" said Arjuna. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">As Dhananjaya's chariot sped on towards Bhishma, it met a hot reception from the grandsire, who covered it with his arrows. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">But, Arjuna bent his bow and discharged three shafts that broke the grandsire's bow. Bhishma picked up another bow but it too met the same fate. The grandsire's heart was gladdened when he saw Arjuna's skill in archery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Hail, brave warrior!\" applauded the grandsire, even as, taking up another bow; he poured shafts on Arjuna's chariot with unerring aim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoBodyTextIndent\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Krishna was not happy at the way Arjuna met the attack. The grandsire's bow was working fiercely. But Arjuna's hands did not do their best, for his heart was not in it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NuQZ0qWSdaE/TsJjFwel0uI/AAAAAAAAIew/Wa-En7RiVOg/s1600/imagesCAJPKUNS.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"249\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NuQZ0qWSdaE/TsJjFwel0uI/AAAAAAAAIew/Wa-En7RiVOg/s320/imagesCAJPKUNS.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">He had too much regard for his great grandsire. Krishna thought that, if Arjuna went on like this, the army, which had been so badly demoralized already, would be utterly destroyed and all would be lost. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Krishna managed the chariot skilfully, but in spite of it, both he and Arjuna were hit many times by Bhishma's arrows. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Janardana's (Krishna) anger rose. \"I can stand this no longer, Arjuna. I shall kill Bhishma myself if you will not do it!\" he exclaimed, and dropping the reins, he took up his discus and jumped down from the chariot and dashed forward towards Bhishma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhishma was far from being perturbed at this. On the contrary, his face expanded with ecstatic joy. \"Come, come, Oh Lotus-eyed One!\" he exclaimed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"I bow to you, Oh Madhava. Lord of the World, have you indeed come down from the chariot for my sake? I offer you my life. If I be slain by you, I shall be glorified in the three worlds. Give me that boon. May your hands take this life away and save me for eternity.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_bRpqr0S0Pg/TsJjKosPm1I/AAAAAAAAIe4/yRiKs-1P5Ao/s1600/imagesCAJY6JJM.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_bRpqr0S0Pg/TsJjKosPm1I/AAAAAAAAIe4/yRiKs-1P5Ao/s320/imagesCAJY6JJM.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna was distressed to see this. He jumped down and ran after Krishna. Overtaking him with great difficulty, he entreated Krishna to turn back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Do not lose your patience with me. Desist and I promise not to flinch,\" he said, and persuaded Krishna to return. The chariot reins were again in Krishna's hands. Arjuna attacked the Kaurava forces furiously and thousands were slain by him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Kauravas suffered a severe defeat on the evening of the third day. As they returned to their camps in torchlight, they said to one another: \"Who can equal Arjuna? There is nothing strange in his being victorious.\" So marvelous was Arjuna's prowess that day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-R6YtRf-_MJg/TsJjPIEE1cI/AAAAAAAAIfA/EYRlWendbso/s1600/imagesCAKN1PBH.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-R6YtRf-_MJg/TsJjPIEE1cI/AAAAAAAAIfA/EYRlWendbso/s320/imagesCAKN1PBH.jpg\" width=\"224\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">The Fourth Day</span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">THE battle was very much the same every day and the narrative is one of monotonous fighting and killing. Still, the great battle is the central event in the Mahabharata and, if we skip over it, we cannot fully understand the epic heroes of that crowded stage. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">At break of day, Bhishma arrayed the Kaurava forces again. Surrounded by Drona, Duryodhana and others, the grandsire looked verily like great Indra, holding his thunder bolt, surrounded by the devas. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Kaurava army, with its chariots, elephants and horses all arrayed in battle order and ready for the fight, presented the appearance of the sky in a great thunderstorm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The grandsire gave orders for advance. Arjuna watched the hostile movements from his chariot, whereon the Hanuman flag was waving, and he too got ready. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The battle commenced. Aswatthama, Bhurisravas, Salya, Chitrasena and the son of Chala surrounded Abhimanyu and attacked him. The warrior fought like a lion opposing five elephants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna saw this combined attack on his son and, with a wrathful lion roar joined his son whereat the tempo of fighting flared up. Dhrishtadyumna also arrived with a large force. The son of Chala was killed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WU3zZuCsJp0/TsJjTtKhL0I/AAAAAAAAIfI/iaxxsGk-TjU/s1600/imagesCAKOJTSJ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WU3zZuCsJp0/TsJjTtKhL0I/AAAAAAAAIfI/iaxxsGk-TjU/s400/imagesCAKOJTSJ.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Chala himself now joined and he with Salya, made a strong attack on Dhrishtadyumna. The latter's bow was severed into two by a sharp missile discharged by Salya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Abhimanyu saw this and sent a shower of arrows on Salya and put him in such danger that Duryodhana and his brothers rushed to Salya's help. Bhimasena also appeared on the scene at this juncture. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">When Bhima raised his mace aloft, Duryodhana's brothers lost courage. Duryodhana, who saw this, was exceedingly angry and immediately charged against Bhima with a large force of elephants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">As soon as Bhima saw the elephants coming up, he descended from his chariot, iron mace in hand, attacked them so fiercely that they scattered in a wild stampede, throwing the Kaurava ranks into disorder. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">It will be seen that even in our Puranic stories elephants fared as badly in battle as they did in the wars of the Greeks and the Romans. Bhima's attack on the elephants was like Indra's devastating onslaught on the winged mountains. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C1LTZX9He5o/TsJjY0P0VGI/AAAAAAAAIfQ/a8JbAQmJ-HI/s1600/imagesCAKTJJEM.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C1LTZX9He5o/TsJjY0P0VGI/AAAAAAAAIfQ/a8JbAQmJ-HI/s320/imagesCAKTJJEM.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The slaughtered elephants lay dead on the field like great hills. Those that escaped fled in panic and caused great havoc in the Kaurava army, trampling numerous soldiers in their wild race. Duryodhana, thereupon, ordered a wholesale attack on Bhima. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">But he stood firm as a rock and presently, the Pandava warriors came up and joined him. A number of Duryodhana's arrows struck Bhima's chest and he climbed up his chariot again. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Visoka, now is the glad hour,\" said Bhima to his charioteer. \"I see a number of Dhritarashtra's sons before me, ready to be shaken down like ripe fruits on a tree. Keep your hold well on the reins and drive on. I am going to dispatch these wretches to Yama's abode.\" Bhima's arrows would have killed Duryodhana then and there, had it not been for his armor. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Eight of Duryodhana's brothers were slain in that day's battle by Bhima. Duryodhana fought fiercely. Bhima's bow was smashed by one of Duryodhana's arrows. Taking up a fresh bow, Bhima sent an arrow with a knife-edge at Duryodhana that cut the latter's bow into two. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-A85u4UQ-oCU/TsJjdHFzmAI/AAAAAAAAIfY/NOyKf2clk9w/s1600/imagesCALJTRDF.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"164\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-A85u4UQ-oCU/TsJjdHFzmAI/AAAAAAAAIfY/NOyKf2clk9w/s320/imagesCALJTRDF.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Not baffled by this, Duryodhana took up a fresh bow and discharged a well-aimed shaft which struck Bhima on his chest with such force that he reeled and sat down. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The Pandava warriors now poured a great shower of arrows on Duryodhana. Ghatotkacha, who saw his father sit dazed with the force of the blow, got exceedingly angry and fell on the Kaurava army, which was unable to stand against his onslaught.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"We cannot fight this Rakshasa today.\" said Bhishma to Drona. \"Our men are weary.<b> </b>It is nearing sunset and at night of the Rakshasas grows stronger with the darkness. Let us deal with Ghatotkacha tomorrow.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The grandsire ordered his army to retire for the night. Duryodhana sat musing in his tent, his eyes filled with tears. He had lost many of his brothers in that day's battle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Sanjaya,\" exclaimed Dhritarashtra. \"Every day, you give me nothing but bad news. Your tale has ever been one of sorrow, of defeat and loss of dear ones! I cannot stand this any more. What stratagem can save my people? How are<b> </b>we going to win in this fight? Indeed, I am full of fear. It seems fate is more powerful than human effort.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FsEE1U_MExg/TsJjkfk5aEI/AAAAAAAAIfg/b5_e191BWyk/s1600/imagesCAM8ZFV9.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"280\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FsEE1U_MExg/TsJjkfk5aEI/AAAAAAAAIfg/b5_e191BWyk/s320/imagesCAM8ZFV9.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"King \" said Sanjaya in reply, \"is this not all the result of your own folly? Of what avail is grief? How can I manufacture good news for you? You should hear the truth with fortitude.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Ah! Vidura's words are coming true,\" said the blind old king, plunged in great grief.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">The Fifth Day</span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"I AM like a shipwrecked man seeking to save himself by swimming in a storm tossed ocean. I shall surely drown, overwhelmed in this sea of sorrow.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Again and again, when Sanjaya related the happenings of the great battle, Dhritarashtra would thus lament, unable to bear his grief.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Bhima is going to kill all my sons,\" he said. \"I do not believe there is anyone with prowess enough in our army to protect my sons from death. Did Bhishma, Drona, Kripa and Aswatthama look on unconcerned when our army fled in terror? What indeed is their plan? When and how are they going to help Duryodhana? How are my sons to escape from destruction?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gYeSj8nT_hw/TsJjqCwJ-_I/AAAAAAAAIfo/-dJCdnPV2CQ/s1600/imagesCAMPZX1F.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"218\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gYeSj8nT_hw/TsJjqCwJ-_I/AAAAAAAAIfo/-dJCdnPV2CQ/s320/imagesCAMPZX1F.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Saying thus, the blind old king burst into tears. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoBodyTextIndent\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Calm yourself, King,\" said Sanjaya. \"The Pandavas rest on the strength of a just cause. So, they win. Your sons are brave but their thoughts are wicked. Therefore, luck does not favor them. They have done great injustice to the Pandavas, and they are reaping the harvest of their sins. The Pandavas are not winning by charms or magic incantations. They are fighting according to the practice of kshatriyas. Their cause being just, they have strength. Friends advised you, but you discarded wise counsel. Vidura, Bhishma, Drona and I tried to stop you in your unwise course, but you did not listen and you went on. Like a foolish sick man who refuses to drink bitter medicine, you obstinately refused to follow our advice, which would have saved your people, preferring to do as your foolish son desired. You are in distress now. Last night, Duryodhana asked Bhishma the same question as you put to me now. And Bhishma gave the same answer as I give you.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">When the fighting was stopped on the evening of the fourth day, Duryodhana went by himself to Bhishma's tent and, bowing reverently, said:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qLKwJ0iaK70/TsJjvKklWCI/AAAAAAAAIfw/rs_T2dHyjN4/s1600/imagesCAN2CC2J.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"256\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qLKwJ0iaK70/TsJjvKklWCI/AAAAAAAAIfw/rs_T2dHyjN4/s320/imagesCAN2CC2J.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Grandsire, the world knows that you are a warrior who knows not fear. The same is the case with Drona, Kripa, Aswatthama, Kritavarma, Sudakshin, Bhurisravas, Vikarna and Bhagadatta. Death has no terror for these veterans. There is no doubt, the prowess of these great warriors is limitless, even like your own. All the Pandavas combined cannot defeat any one of you. What then is the mystery behind this daily defeat of our army at the hands of the sons of Kunti?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhishma replied: \"Prince, listen to me. I have given you advice on every occasion and told you what was good for you. But, you have always refused to follow what your elders counselled you to do. Again, I tell you that it is best for you to make peace with Pandu's sons. For your good as well as for that of the world, that is the only course that should be followed. Belonging to the same royal house, you can all enjoy this vast country as yours. I gave you this advice, but you disregarded it and have grievously wronged the Pandavas, the fruit of which you are now reaping. The Pandavas are protected by Krishna himself.
