They looked for him in all sorts of places and found him, at last, on the bank of the Ganga, hiding himself behind Vyasa. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">When he saw the Pandavas and Janardana approaching, Aswatthama quietly took up a blade of grass and charged it with the mantra of destruction and sent it forward saying: \"May this destroy the race of the Pandavas.\" And it went straight to the womb of Uttara who bore in her the son of Abhimanyu. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uWC7s5orOBA/TsM7QtSN07I/AAAAAAAAIo4/6rkhYIi6TDw/s1600/imagesCALRW7ER.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uWC7s5orOBA/TsM7QtSN07I/AAAAAAAAIo4/6rkhYIi6TDw/s1600/imagesCALRW7ER.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The race of the Pandavas would have been destroyed thereby but for the intervention of Sri Krishna who saved the child in the mother's womb. This child was Parikshit who was later crowned by Yudhishthira when the Pandavas retired to the forest. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Aswatthama pried out the shining jewel that was part of his head and gave it to Bhima, acknowledging his defeat, and went away to the forest. Bhima took the great jewel and, going to Draupadi said: \"Angel of spotless purity, this is for you. The man, who killed your beloved sons, has been vanquished. Duryodhana has been destroyed. I have drunk the blood of Duhsasana. I have avenged the great outrage and discharged my debts.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Draupadi took the jewel and, going up to Yudhishthira bowed and said: \"Faultless king, it befits you to wear this in your crown.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6I_MgsP7Edw/TsM5gsrO8vI/AAAAAAAAImg/BtXRX2e0CX8/s1600/imagesCA7BLFQ0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6I_MgsP7Edw/TsM5gsrO8vI/AAAAAAAAImg/BtXRX2e0CX8/s1600/imagesCA7BLFQ0.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">Who Can Give Solace?<o:p></o:p></span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">WHEN the battle was over, Hastinapura was a city of mourning. All the women and children were weeping and lamenting their slain, nearest and dearest. With many thousands of bereaved women accompanying, Dhritarashtra went to the field of battle. At Kurukshetra, the scene of terrible destruction, the blind king thought of all that had passed, and wept aloud. But, of what avail was weeping?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pXcK8XBVY68/TsM_IGD9ydI/AAAAAAAAIsE/w0UO_KGlfdg/s1600/imagesCABMV2LI.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pXcK8XBVY68/TsM_IGD9ydI/AAAAAAAAIsE/w0UO_KGlfdg/s1600/imagesCABMV2LI.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoBodyTextIndent\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 1em 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"O king, words of consolation addressed to a bereaved person do not remove his grief. Thousands of rulers have given up their lives in battle for your sons. It is now time that you should arrange for proper funeral ceremonies for the dead,\" said Sanjaya to Dhritarashtra. <o:p></o:p><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"It is not right to grieve for those who die in battle. When souls have left their bodies, there is nothing like relationship, nothing like brother or son or relative. Your sons have really no connection with you. Relationship ends with death, being only a bodily connection and a mere minor incident in the<b> </b>soul's eternal life. From the nowhere do lives come, and, with death,<b> </b>they again disappear into nowhere. Why should we weep for them? Those who die in battle after a heroic fight go as guests to receive Indra's hospitality. Grieving for what is past, you cannot gain anything in the nature of dharma, pleasure or wealth.\" Thus, and in many more ways, did the wise and good Vidura try to assuage the king's grief. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ise9uxBC224/TsM7LiD4r7I/AAAAAAAAIow/DEfdEXEdFKg/s1600/imagesCALFDO7V.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ise9uxBC224/TsM7LiD4r7I/AAAAAAAAIow/DEfdEXEdFKg/s1600/imagesCALFDO7V.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Vyasa also approached Dhritarashtra tenderly and said: \"Dear son, there is nothing that you do not know and which you have to learn from me. You know very well that all living beings must die. This great battle came to reduce earth's burden as I have heard from Lord Vishnu Himself. That is why this calamity could not be prevented. Henceforth, Yudhishthira is your son. You should try to love him and in that way bear the burden of life, giving up grief.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Making his way, through the crowd of weeping women Yudhishthira approached Dhritarashtra and bowed before him. Dhritarashtra embraced Yudhishthira, but there was no love in that embrace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Then Bhimasena was announced to the blind king. \"Come,\" said Dhritarashtra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">But Vasudeva was wise. He gently pushed Bhima aside and placed an iron figure before the blind Dhritarashtra, knowing the old king's exceeding anger. Dhritarashtra hugged the metal statue to his bosom in a firm embrace and then the thought came to him of how this man had killed everyone of his sons. And his wrath increased to such a pitch that the image was crushed to pieces in his embrace. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Ha! My anger has deceived me,\" cried Dhritarashtra. \"I have killed dear Bhima.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LxBDVvo1Lus/TsM5cY_VWMI/AAAAAAAAImY/Sk03lLomEXU/s1600/imagesCA5PF4YC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LxBDVvo1Lus/TsM5cY_VWMI/AAAAAAAAImY/Sk03lLomEXU/s1600/imagesCA5PF4YC.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Then Krishna said to the blind king: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Lord, I knew that it would be thus and I prevented the disaster. You have not killed Bhimasena. You have crushed only an iron image that I placed instead before you. May your anger be appeased with what you have done to this image. Bhima is still alive.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The king was composed somewhat and he blessed Bhima and the other Pandavas who then took leave of him and went to Gandhari.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ZGmcGWA9mx8/TsM_D5W5w_I/AAAAAAAAIr8/2ZA0tJ3b0jw/s1600/imagesCAB3T9I7.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ZGmcGWA9mx8/TsM_D5W5w_I/AAAAAAAAIr8/2ZA0tJ3b0jw/s1600/imagesCAB3T9I7.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Vyasa was with Gandhari. \"Oh queen,\"said the rishi, \"be not angry with the Pandavas. Did you not tell them even when the battle began: 'Where there is dharma, there surely will be victory'? And so it has happened. It is not right to let the mind dwell on what is past and nurse one's anger. You must now call to aid your great fortitude.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Gandhari said: \"Bhagavan, I do not envy the victory of the Pandavas. It is true that grief for the death of my sons has robbed me of my understanding. These Pandavas also are my sons. I know that Duhsasana and Sakuni brought about this destruction of our people. Arjuna and Bhima are blameless. Pride brought this battle about and my sons deserve the fate they have met. I do not complain about it. But then, in Vasudeva's presence, Bhima called Duryodhana to battle and they fought. And, knowing that Duryodhana was stronger and could not<b> </b>be defeated in single combat, Bhima struck him below the navel and killed him. Vasudeva was looking on. This was wrong and it is this that I find it impossible to forgive.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_dGRzFEymJI/TsM7Gk2pEFI/AAAAAAAAIoo/rkdrQ59_tpI/s1600/imagesCAKOML2D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_dGRzFEymJI/TsM7Gk2pEFI/AAAAAAAAIoo/rkdrQ59_tpI/s1600/imagesCAKOML2D.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhima, who heard this, came near and said: \"Mother, I did this to save myself in battle. Whether it was right or wrong, you should bear with me. Your son was invincible in combat and so I did in self-protection what was undoubtedly wrong. He called Yudhishthira to play and deceived him. We had been wronged by your son in so many ways. He would not give back the kingdom, of which be took unlawful possession. And you know what your son did to blameless Draupadi. If we had killed your son on the spot, when he misbehaved in the Hall of Assembly, surely you would not have blamed us. Bound by Dharmaraja's vow, we restrained ourselves with difficulty then. We have since discharged honor's debt and found satisfaction in battle. Mother, you should forgive me.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Dear son, if you had left but one out of my hundred sons and killed all the rest and satisfied your anger, I and my old husband would have found solace in that surviving son for the rest of our lives. Where is Dharmaputra? Call him.\" She said.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Hearing this, Yudhishthira trembled as he, with clasped hands, approached Gandhari, whose eyes were bound in a cloth in loyal lifelong penance for her husband's blindness. He bowed low before her and said softly:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Queen, the cruel Yudhishthira, who killed your sons, stands before you fit to be cursed. Do curse me who have committed great sin. I care not for life or for kingdom.\" Saying this, he fell on the ground and touched her feet. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-x4CHuThLDgA/TsM5X54I5XI/AAAAAAAAImQ/GKFLokHTrDQ/s1600/imagesCA4K7MXT.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-x4CHuThLDgA/TsM5X54I5XI/AAAAAAAAImQ/GKFLokHTrDQ/s1600/imagesCA4K7MXT.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Gandhari heaved a deep sigh and stood mute. She turned her head aside knowing that if, through the cloth with which her eyes were bound, her vision fell on the prostrate Yudhishthira he would be reduced to ashes on the spot. But through a little space in the cloth, even as she turned her face away, her eyes fell on the toe of the prostrate Yudhishthira. At once, says the poet, the toe was charred black. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna knew the power of bereaved Gandhari's wrath, and hid himself behind Vasudeva. The wise and good Gandhari suppressed all her anger and blessed the Pandavas and sent them to Kunti. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-cg4aAGuvr98/TsM-_evJ_iI/AAAAAAAAIr0/bnJx6QcXDn8/s1600/imagesCAAXAKC4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-cg4aAGuvr98/TsM-_evJ_iI/AAAAAAAAIr0/bnJx6QcXDn8/s1600/imagesCAAXAKC4.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Gandhari turned to Draupadi, who was in lamentation, having lost all her sons. \"Dear girl,\" said Gandhari. \"Do not grieve. Who can give solace to you and me? It is through my fault that this great tribe has been destroyed altogether.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">Yudhishthira's Anguish<o:p></o:p></span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">THE Pandavas performed the til and water ceremonies for the peace of the souls of the dead warriors and camped on the bank of the Ganga for a month. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">One day, Narada appeared before Yudhishthira. \"Son, through Krishna's grace, the valor of Arjuna and the power of your dharma, you were victorious and you are the sovereign lord of the land. Are you happy?\" he asked. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6sNiArWfoIg/TsM7Aa4x2SI/AAAAAAAAIog/zxqoxZ4uflk/s1600/imagesCAK1LI7O.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6sNiArWfoIg/TsM7Aa4x2SI/AAAAAAAAIog/zxqoxZ4uflk/s1600/imagesCAK1LI7O.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Yudhishthira replied: \"Bhagavan, it is true the kingdom has come into my possession. But my kinsmen are all gone. We have lost sons that were dear. This victory appears to me but a great defeat. O Narada, we took our own brother for an enemy and killed him, even Karna who stood rooted like a rock in his honor and at whose valor the world wondered. This terrible act of slaying our own brothers was the result of our sinful attachment to our possessions. Karna, on the other hand, kept the promise he gave to our mother and abstained from killing us. Oh! I am a sinner, a low fellow who murdered his own brother. My mind is troubled greatly at this thought. Karna's feet were so much like our mother's feet. In the large hall, when that great outrage was committed and my anger rose, when I looked at his feet, which were so much like Kunti's feet, my wrath subsided. I remember that now and my grief increases.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dnuT5dbzLvc/TsM-6xwfwaI/AAAAAAAAIrs/4QsAZEWxsvc/s1600/imagesCA81EDAQ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dnuT5dbzLvc/TsM-6xwfwaI/AAAAAAAAIrs/4QsAZEWxsvc/s1600/imagesCA81EDAQ.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">So saying, Yudhishthira heaved a deep sigh. Narada told him all about Karna and the curses that had been pronounced on him on various occasions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Once, when Karna saw that Arjuna was superior to him in archery, he approached Drona and entreated him to teach him how to wield the Brahmastra. Drona declined saying it was not open to him to instruct any but a brahmana of faultless conduct or a kshatriya who had purified himself by much penance. Thereupon, Karna went to the Mahendra hills and deceived Parasurama by saying that he was a brahmana and became his disciple. From him he obtained instruction in archery and the use of many astras. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">One day, when Karna was practising with his bow in the forest near Parasurama's asrama, a brahmana's cow was accidentally hit and killed. The brahmana was angry and uttered a curse on Karna: \"In battle, your chariot wheels will stick in the mud and you will be done to death, even like this innocent cow which you have killed.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-T-RDUqiVwCY/TsM5TyYSFpI/AAAAAAAAImI/t0d9kG-BRXc/s1600/imagesCA3L2U42.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-T-RDUqiVwCY/TsM5TyYSFpI/AAAAAAAAImI/t0d9kG-BRXc/s1600/imagesCA3L2U42.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Parasurama was exceedingly fond of Karna and taught him all the archery he knew and instructed him fully in the use and the withdrawing of the Brahmastra. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-egMUQtkXKG4/TsM6kjctPJI/AAAAAAAAIoQ/HA123vxxpag/s1600/imagesCAJDRJOJ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-egMUQtkXKG4/TsM6kjctPJI/AAAAAAAAIoQ/HA123vxxpag/s1600/imagesCAJDRJOJ.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">One day, however, he discovered that the disciple was not a brahmana. It happened tha an an insect bit a hole into Karna's thigh when one afternoon the teacher had fallen asleep on Karna's lap. Karna bore the acute pain quietly and did not stir, lest the master should wake up. The warm blood trickling from the wound woke up Parasurama. When he saw what had happened, he was angry.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EuIUAfTkC3A/TsM-3M1tuvI/AAAAAAAAIrk/VwnmUzO2dO0/s1600/imagesCA49PJXR.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EuIUAfTkC3A/TsM-3M1tuvI/AAAAAAAAIrk/VwnmUzO2dO0/s1600/imagesCA49PJXR.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"You are a kshatriya; otherwise you could not have borne this physical pain without stirring. Tell me the truth. You are not a brahmana. You have deceived your teacher. Fool! When your hour comes, your knowledge of astras will fail you and what you have learnt from me through deception will not avail you.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Parasurama's wrath against kshatriyas is well known and, when he discovered that Karna was a kshatriya, he cursed him thus in his anger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Karna was free in making gifts. One day, Indra, who was Arjuna's father, came in the garb of a brahmana and begged of Karna for a gift of the divine earrings and armor with which he had been born. Karna took them out and gave them away accordingly. From that time, Karna's strength was reduced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Karna's pledge to his mother Kunti that he would not kill more than one of the five of you, Parasurarna's curse, the anger of the brahmana whose cow was killed by Karna, the way in which his charioteer Salya depressed him by underrating his valor and Vasudeva's stratagems, these combined to bring about Karna's end. Do not grieve believing that you alone caused his death.\" Thus said Narada, but Yudhishthira was not consoled by these words. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3IP8OHhXSF0/TsM6fjQsMhI/AAAAAAAAIoI/qD4nIW7YD1U/s1600/imagesCAHP9MUM.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3IP8OHhXSF0/TsM6fjQsMhI/AAAAAAAAIoI/qD4nIW7YD1U/s1600/imagesCAHP9MUM.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"Do not blame yourself, son, for Karna's, death,\" said Kunti. \"His father, the sun lord himself, pleaded with him. He begged of him to give up the wicked-hearted Duryodhana and join you. I too tried hard. But he would not listen to us. He brought his end on himself.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"You deceived us, mother\" said Yudhishthira, \"by hiding the secret of his birth from us. You became thus the cause of this great sin. May women never be able to keep a secret henceforth.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">This is the poet's story of how Yudhishthira cursed all women in his anguish over having killed his own elder brother. It is a common notion that women cannot keep secrets. And this story is a beautiful conception illustrating that popular belief. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">It may be that in worldly affairs, it is an advantage to be able to keep secrets. But it is not great virtue from the point of view of moral character, and women need not grieve over an incapacity of this kind, if indeed Kunti's legacy still persists. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1I0EolUAT5g/TsM5OH96eII/AAAAAAAAImA/7ZaBkCRJkZw/s1600/imagesCA3EZXSS.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"355\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1I0EolUAT5g/TsM5OH96eII/AAAAAAAAImA/7ZaBkCRJkZw/s1600/imagesCA3EZXSS.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">The affectionate temperament natural to women may perhaps incline them to openness. But some women do keep secrets very well indeed, and not a man possess this ability either. It is a fallacy to attribute the differences that arise out of training and occupation on nature itself and imagine some qualities as peculiar to a sex. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: black; text-transform: uppercase;\">Yudhishthira Comforted</span></b><span style=\"color: black;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">YUDHISHTHIRA'S pain of mind increased everyday as he thought of all the kinsmen that had been killed. He was stricken with intense remorse and decided he must give up the world go to the forest and do penance to expiate his sin. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-sF42tW6Sniw/TsM-zEE8oiI/AAAAAAAAIrc/OkeeVR5BKZU/s1600/imagesCA9ICQ0T.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"274\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-sF42tW6Sniw/TsM-zEE8oiI/AAAAAAAAIrc/OkeeVR5BKZU/s1600/imagesCA9ICQ0T.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"I see no joy or good,\" he said to his brothers, in taking up the office of king or in worldly enjoyment. Do rule the land yourselves leaving me free to go to the forest.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Arjuna talked of the nobility of family life and the entire good one may do without taking sanyasa. Bhimasena also spoke and harshly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"You talk, alas\"' he said, \"like a dull-witted person who has committed to memory the texts of the sastras without understanding their sense. Sanyasa is not the dharma of kshatriyas. The duty of a kshatriya, is to live an active life and perform his proper task, not to go to the forest renouncing activity.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-s9K_oC8JyNI/TsM5KXuzyCI/AAAAAAAAIl4/oR76vGFfMBM/s1600/imagesCA0TZRIB.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"295\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-s9K_oC8JyNI/TsM5KXuzyCI/AAAAAAAAIl4/oR76vGFfMBM/s1600/imagesCA0TZRIB.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Nakula also contested the propriety of Dharmaputra's proposal and insisted that the path of work was the right one to follow and the way of sanyasa was beset with difficulties. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Sahadeva also argued likewise and entreated: \"You are my father, my mother, my teacher, as well as brother. Do not leave us, bear with us.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Draupadi also spoke. \"It was right we killed Duryodhana and his men. Why should we regret it? Among the duties of a king is included the inflicting of just punishment. It cannot be avoided and is an essential part of the ruler's duty. You have meted just punishment too evildoers. There is no cause whatsoever for contrition. It is now your sacred duty to take up the burden of governing the land according to dharma. Cease grieving.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0p2v0QRdDOw/TsM6argkYZI/AAAAAAAAIoA/mGSwllzFHYo/s1600/imagesCAH5MEZC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0p2v0QRdDOw/TsM6argkYZI/AAAAAAAAIoA/mGSwllzFHYo/s1600/imagesCAH5MEZC.jpg\" width=\"229\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Then Vyasa spoke to Yudhishthira at length and explained where his duty lay, pointing out precedents, and persuaded him to go to the city and take up the burden of ruling the land. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0gYSJRU8pFE/TsM662x_zBI/AAAAAAAAIoY/aVwrufBpflw/s1600/imagesCAJXQ5TV.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"250\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0gYSJRU8pFE/TsM662x_zBI/AAAAAAAAIoY/aVwrufBpflw/s1600/imagesCAJXQ5TV.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Yudhishthira was duly crowned at Hastinapura. Before taking up the duties of the State, Yudhishthira went to where Bhishma lay on his bed of arrows awaiting his death, and took his blessing and instruction in dharma. This instruction of Bhishmacharya to king Yudhishthira is the famous Santiparva of the Mahabharata. After the discourse was over, Bhishma's soul passed out. The king went to the Ganga and offered libations, in accordance with ancient custom, for the peace of the departed soul.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: black;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-yy5sfx-v2RY/TsM-ty0RCEI/AAAAAAAAIrU/RWJYRFiaVGs/s1600/imagesCA7E61KG.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-yy5sfx-v2RY/TsM-ty0RCEI/AAAAAAAAIrU/RWJYRFiaVGs/s1600/imagesCA7E61KG.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">After the ceremony was over, Yudhishthira went up the bank. There, as he stood for a while, all the tragic events came back to his mind, and overcome by intense grief, he fell senseless on the ground, like an elephant struck down by the hunter. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">Bhima went up to his big brother and caressed him tenderly and spoke to him soothing words. Dhritarashtra also came up and said to Yudhishthira: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: black;\">\"You should not grieve like this. Arise and, assisted by your brothers and friends, reign over the kingdom that awaits your rule. Your duty now is to do what appertains to the office of king. Leave grief to Gandhari and me. You achieved victory in battle in accordance with the dharma of warriors. The duties appertaining to that victory await your attention now. Fool that I was, I did not pay heed to the words of Vidura and committed a great error. I listened to the ignorant words of Duryodhana and deceived myself. Like gold seen in a dream the glory has vanished. My hundred sons have disappeared into the world of nowhere. But I have you as my son now. Do not grieve.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">END OF WAR\u2014BUT THE EPIC CONTINUES</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tangled intertwined nature of issues is clear from the fact that in the Mahabharata <span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes;\">&nbsp;</span>nobody wants this war and yet nobody could avoid it. <span style=\"mso-spacerun: yes;\">&nbsp;</span>It came with all the bloody killings and disaster. But the Mahabharata is much more than a mere description of the blood-bath which was the battle of Kurukshetra. </span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">The finest flower of&nbsp;chivalry and heroism perished in the flames of war in a matter of eighteen days.</span> </span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mahabharat answers these vital questions of life, which grows in complexity as it evolves as if driven by an inner, inevitable logic of its own. The Mahabharat is a great and glorious epic poetry, but even more than its liquid and lyrical quality is the force of its logic, and this is why it overpowers the heart as well as the mind. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">Throughout the past thousand years of the history of Hinduism, the popularity and authority of the Bhagavad Gita, the Song of the Lord, has been, and still is, unrivaled. Whoever reads it for the first time will be struck by the beauty and depth; </span>countless Hindus know it by heart and quote it at many occasions as an expression of their faith and their own insights.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The theology of the Bhagavad Gita is attractive because it does not favor of any of the path. </span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">Whatever works for you is the truth, a pragmatic attitude which is Hinduism's great and old strength</span>. </span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 10pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Gita is thus a product of mature Hinduism. The Gita boldly asserts that dharma is possible without renunciation, and many reformers have seized upon that to try and awaken Indians from a too comfortable 'spiritual' torpor-- catalysed by the earlier Ramayana war.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><em><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">The finale of Mahabharat are impressive. Rishi Vyasa concludes: \"Dharma is eternal; life, its joys and sorrow are not. Do not give away the eternal for the temporal values of life.\"</span></span></em></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div align=\"center\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><em><span style=\"color: blue;\">Do not to others what ye do not wish<br />\nDone to yourself; and wish for others too<br />\nWhat ye desire and long for, for yourself \u2014 This is the whole of dharma \u2014 heed \u2014it well. <o:p></o:p></span></em></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><em><span style=\"color: blue;\">  </span></em><br />\n</span><br />\n<div align=\"center\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><em><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;\">\u2014 Veda Vyasa, The Mahabharata.</span><o:p></o:p></span></em></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Note: The Institute for\nScientific Research on Vedas (I-SERVE), planetarium software has ascertained\nthe birth of Lord Rama as 10th January 5114 BC in Ayodhya. As per the Indian\ncalendar the time of the birth is in-between 12 noon and 1pm, Shukla Paksha in\nChaitra month. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">EPILOGUE:</span></i><br />\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">After the great\nKuruskhetra war , that &nbsp;nearly destroyed\nhumankind and humanity alike, the battle field lay still ! The battle was over\n, and the vast field lay blood soaked and strewn with bodies of kings, princes\nand soldiers .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">There was no mood for\nhip-hip huzzah among the surviving Pandava army. Most stood sullen and stunned\nby the gruesome scene .They were devastated at the destruction that a single\nwar had caused. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Stunned and speechless,\nthey scanned the battle field to check out for survivors among the lifeless. &nbsp;Gandhari with her blind fold still in place\nwas crying over her dead sons. &nbsp;She was\nrambling in extreme grief , her speech slurred. \u201cDuryodhana , my son , open\nyour eyes. speak to me my first born\u2026A hundred did we bear, all fine and proud.\nWas it for such a foolish end? Her husband, the blind king Dritharashtra stood\nby, looking lost.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Pandavas and\nKrishna hurried over to Gandhari and Dritharashtra, to offer their respects,\napologies and condolences. &nbsp;Sanjaya, the\nking\u2019s escort, gently bent down to Gandhari, to inform the blindfolded woman of\nthe arrival of the Pandavas and Krishna. Her grief turned to a burning rage .&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RufnJpJLEcU/VAVzd4HdY5I/AAAAAAAAvd0/6u4MvZFQ9O8/s1600/doffwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RufnJpJLEcU/VAVzd4HdY5I/AAAAAAAAvd0/6u4MvZFQ9O8/s1600/doffwnload.jpg\" width=\"264\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">She went up to Krishna and screamed .The Pandavas recoiled in fear. &nbsp;Gandhari cried out to Krishna \u201cYou, who I\nworshipped as Vishnu and You, known as an avatar of the supreme godhead. Aren\u2019t\nyou ashamed of your doings? Could you not have averted this war with your\ndivine will and power? Is this how you answer my prayers? Ask your mother,\nDevaki, the pain of losing a child. She had seven of her children being killed\nat birth and now I have seen a hundred sons of mine being butchered to death\u201d .&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna laughed gently.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">She now vented her steam \u201c Oh mocking god , If my years\nof Vishnu bhakthi have been true, and if I have been true to my husband with\nthis blindf, then, may you die in 36 years from today. May Dwaraka be floodeld\n, may every one of your Yadava kin perish by killing each other, just as you\nmade the kins of Kuru kill one another. May the Yadavas perish \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Suddenly the gravity of\nher words dawned on her . She has indeed been true to her devotion to Vishnu\nand to her blindfold . Her curse would take effect .&nbsp; Her anger vapourised and she fell at Krishna\u2019s\nfeet for foregiveness .</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna smiled and gently lifted her up. He whispered \u201c\nOh mother , your curse will take effect, not only because of your true devotion\ntowards me and your husband, but also due to the ever changing sands of time.\nIn the mean time, let\u2019s attend to the tending of the dead and sending them away\non their journey to the heavens.\u201d Lord Krishna walked past the stunned\nPandavas.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">After the war was over\nKrishna was himself contemplating the end of the snooty Yadav race. They were\nvery powerful under the protection of lord Krishna so no external force could\ndefeat them. &nbsp;If the Yadavas were\nunharnessed , they will become a burden to the planet. Krishna realized the gravity\nof the situation and the importance of bringing the destruction of his own beloved\nrace. &nbsp;Gandhari\u2019s curse came at the right\ntime as if on divine cue.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Days flew by after the\ncoronation of Yudhishtra as the king of Hasthinapur. Krishna went back to\nDwaraka to rule over the prosperous kingdom. &nbsp;Slowly but steadily the the curse of Gandhari bore\nfruit.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The pompous Yadavas shed\ntheir conduct, morals, scruples and humility. &nbsp;One incident sealed their fate. Some great\nsages were on pilgrimage and they stopped by at Dwarka to meet Krishna and Balarama.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Yadavas, which\nincluded Bhodakas, Vrishnis, Kekeyas and Andakas, wre now at the peak of wanton\nuncouth behavior. A bunch of Yadava boys decided to tease the sages. They\ndressed Samba, the handsome son of Krishna &nbsp;as a woman and tied pillows on his stomach to\nmake the woman look pregnant.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They approached the sages and asked them to\npredict whether the 'lady' would give birth to a boy or a girl. &nbsp;The dismayed sages saw through this charade and were\nshocked at this lack pf respect. &nbsp;In\nanger, on of the sages cursed them saying that the disguised boy will give\nbirth to a lump of iron which will destroy the entire Yadava race. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wfZHNGSqaUY/VAVzOJytaBI/AAAAAAAAvds/2CC7xYXKNqw/s1600/KA1_16dd8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Yadavas, again\nshowed extreme disrespect and responded with sarcasm, instead of an apology.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">There was a pall of\nfear and impending doom the next day when Krishna\u2019s son Sambha developed labour\npains and soon delivered an iron mace . They immediately rushed with the mace\nto Akroora and Ugrasena and in the presence of Krishna himself; they narrated\nthe weird tide of events.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;Krishna knew\nthe events which would transpire in future , and kept quiet. Seeing Krishna\nsilent , Akroora cried \u201cGrind the mace to a fine powder and cast it into the ocean.\u201d\nThe Yadavas nodded and ran to comply.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Akroora looked with\nintent at Krishna, his eyes full of questions. &nbsp;Krishna simply smiled back. \u201cUncle, the Kala\nChakra is now in motion . Sambha has played his part perfectly.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">He left without another\nword, leaving both of them bewildered. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Outside the palace, the\nYadavas had obeyed Akroora\u2019s command and they ground the iron mace into fine\npowder\u2014except for a stubborn triangular piece looking like an arrow head. It\nwas too hard to grind . The Yadavas threw everything into the sea.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The fear disappeared\nand they went back to their wanton and rowdy behavior . They started to drink\nheavily and were intoxicated throughout the day. &nbsp;Time rolled by. The triangular piece of the\nmace was swallowed by a fish. The fish was caught by a hunter, who upon finding\nthe piece in the fish\u2019s entrails immediately used it to craft a fine poisonous\narrow. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The fine powder, on the\nother hand, washed back ashore and deposited itself by the beautiful coast of\nDwaraka. A certain sharp serrated grass grew in lush abundance in the area\nwhere the powder was deposited. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Everything was set and\nin place for the final showdown. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">After 36 years of\nMahabharat war, evil omen started to appear in the Dwaraka city. The Sudarshana\nchakra, Panchajanya shankh, the chariot of lord Krishna and the plough weapon\nof Balarama just disappeared from earth. &nbsp;&nbsp;One\nday, the Yadavas gathered on the beach. The liquor that they drank made them\nlose their senses completely.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They started teasing one another, bringing up the\ngory pasts and gruesome mistakes of each other. &nbsp;Satyaki and Krithavarma acted as the starting\npoints of the doom of Dwaraka. &nbsp;Satyaki\nhad fought on Pandava\u2019s side in the battle of Kurukshetra and Krithavarma, on\nthe Kaurava side. They taunted one another, bringing back memories of the\nhorrific war where the Pandavas cheated against the rules of war , aided and\nabetted by Krishna. &nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In a fit of rage,\nSatyaki, jumped on Krithaverma and cut his head off. The friends of Krithavarma\npounced on Satyaki and a great mass brawl followed. &nbsp;Pradyumna, the son of Krishna, innocent though\nhe was, found himself in the thick of the fight and was killed. &nbsp;As they have come to the sea shore for a pleasure,\nthey did not carry any weapons along with them.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hJxGiH7WH2U/VAVyQ2mYPXI/AAAAAAAAvdc/zDAv0PL7Nec/s1600/downloddad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hJxGiH7WH2U/VAVyQ2mYPXI/AAAAAAAAvdc/zDAv0PL7Nec/s1600/downloddad.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They saw the long grown sharp\nserrated grass in abundance along the sea shore. They picked up the grass stems\nand beat and killed each other. The whole area was soaked in red blood. Those\ngrass stems are nothing but blades made of the powder of the same lump of Iron\nborn to Samba. The curse of saints had borne fruit. Each blade of grass became\na mace, smashing into the Yadavas, killing them instantly. Except Krishna, all\nYadavas were killed. Krishna\u2019s charioteer Daruka and another one called Babhru\nonly survived.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They both approached Sri Krishna and said: \u201cO Krishna! All\nYadavas were killed. Whereabouts of Balarama are not known. It is better to\nsearch for him.\u201d Balarama was in deep meditation under a tree. Seeing this,\nKrishna told Daruka, \u201c\u201cO Daruka! you immediately go to Hastinapura and inform\nDharmaja about the mass massacre of Yadavas and bring Arjuna here. He will look\nafter everything.\u201d said Krishna. Accordingly, Daruka rushed towards Hastinapura\nin a chariot. Krishna went to the place where Balarama was sitting and said \u201cO\nbrother Balarama! I will sit in meditation along with you.\u201d&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5WYVBpcUpzE/VAVyLC8ZhdI/AAAAAAAAvdU/RoShj64X_-A/s1600/ee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5WYVBpcUpzE/VAVyLC8ZhdI/AAAAAAAAvdU/RoShj64X_-A/s1600/ee.jpg\" width=\"293\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">But there was no\nreply from Balarama. A long spiral smoke type serpent came out of the face of\nBalarama. Balarama had just left this mortal body. &nbsp;His soul travelled into the sky through the\nsea. As Balarama was the incarnation of Adi Sesha, Naga community welcomed back\nBalarama. &nbsp;Balarama attained moksha and &nbsp;joined Vishnu at Vaikuntam . <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna knew that the\ntime for him to shed his earthly avatar had come. Krishna knew the only way for\nsomeone to kill him was by wounding his foot. &nbsp;He remembered the curse of Maharishi Durvasa,\nwhich left his foot vulnerable. &nbsp;Krishna\nlaid down under a tree and went into Yoga Samadhi. &nbsp;At that time a hunter Jara entered that forest.\nThat hunter misunderstood the moving foot of Krishna as a lurking deer and shot\na lethal arrow that pierced into Krishna\u2019s feet.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wkB5ORqeQVM/VAVx2M6kicI/AAAAAAAAvdM/R0-UksMLeWQ/s1600/downleeoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wkB5ORqeQVM/VAVx2M6kicI/AAAAAAAAvdM/R0-UksMLeWQ/s1600/downleeoad.jpg\" width=\"268\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">As soon as the hunter reached\nKrishna, he realised his mistake and pleaded the lord for forgiveness. Lord\nKrishna consoles him and tells him how his death was inevitable and things are\ngoing as per divine plan . Krishna says that in his previous birth as Lord Rama\nin the Tretayuga, Rama killed Vaali (Sugreeva's brother) from behind. So,\nKrishna has now reaped the price for the same through Jara who was king Vaali\nin his previous birth.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kDY7601VKBs/VAVxxPWaiQI/AAAAAAAAvdE/tKAR7AIF4m4/s1600/imddages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kDY7601VKBs/VAVxxPWaiQI/AAAAAAAAvdE/tKAR7AIF4m4/s1600/imddages.jpg\" width=\"257\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Such was the Dharma thatt, even for the Ruler of the\nUniverse, the laws of Karma remain the same. Hence, lord Krishna left the\nmortal world. &nbsp;The time from which lord\nKrishna died is considered to be the beginning of Kaliyuga. Daruka, sent by Sri\nKrishna, met Pandavas and informed them about the tragic deaths.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">On hearing\nthis, Pandavas plunged into great grief. After taking suitable instructions\nfrom Dharmaja, Arjuna reached Dwarka. &nbsp;Dwarka\nwas destined to be flooded &nbsp;within seven\ndays of Krishna\u2019s death; hence, Arjuna decided to take the survivors and the Vishnu idol to\nIndraprastha.&nbsp; &nbsp;Krishna's father left for heavenly abode while being in deep meditation.&nbsp; Arjuna performed the last rites for Krishna and his kinsman.&nbsp; All the ladies and\nchildren started moving towards Indraprastha along with Arjuna.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-UIFFL_1KgLA/VAVy5rZLigI/AAAAAAAAvdk/wzCSlf0ORGY/s1600/Dwarka-Golden-Cittyty-Krishna-Balrama.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">As the people\nwalked away from the Dwaraka city, and they looked back for the last time, the\ncity sank into the sea.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-s-ZXJaXtPEQ/VAVxbFHIlaI/AAAAAAAAvc8/-hDU7pOf9Mg/s1600/downddeload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; They tried to rob them. Arjuna who was once a\nvery great archer, found it very difficult to even lift his bow. When he tried\nto invoke his Divya astras, he forgot all those mental passwords to arm his\narrows.. The thieves killed many people and kidnapped some beautiful women. Some\nof the ladies including the wives of Krishna and Balarama self immolated. &nbsp;This was NOT Sati.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Arjuna unable to even protect the women arrived\nat Hastinapur in a most dejected condition, not wishing to live anymore. The\nPandavas visited sage VedaVyasa and narrated the Yadavas destruction, Krishna's\ndeath and Arjuna\u2019s inability to save the Yadava women. The sage consoled the\nPandavas and told them that their purpose on the earth is served.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Pandavas\ncoroneted Parikshit and embarked on their final journey towards the Himalayas with\nDraupdai . The columns of this palace were made of gold.<br /><br />Maya appointed 8000 asuras called Kinkaras to guard this palace. Inside the palace, there were many amazing devices. It took the Maya just fourteen months to complete this building.
